Text:
MOLDS are sometimes microscopic (can’t be seen with the eye) fungi or spores that live on surfaces. These spores can go into the air and be breathed in.

Mold can be an allergy trigger and can cause symptoms to flare for some people with asthma. Mold grows in areas of moisture and high humidity. Common areas are: bathrooms, basements,  potted plants, and areas of indoor water leaks.

 

 

  • Fix water leaks
  • Open a window, and/or use a fan
  • Keep indoor humidity low, best between 30-50%
  • Use hygrometers (found at hardware stores) to measure indoor humidity
  • Use dehumidifier
  • Limit use of humidifiers or vaporizers as they can cause indoor moisture and mold growth
  • Clean and remove mold promptly
targets.Name: Mold
targets.Title: Mold

targets.Name: Cat
Text:
FURRY PETS (Ex. Dogs, Cats, Hamsters, Guinea Pigs, and Rabbits) are common pet allergens that can trigger asthma symptoms in some people.

Pet hair and dander, especially cat hair, can fly in the air and land on surfaces throughout the house.

How to avoid - reduce this trigger ?

  • If allergic to pets, best to remove from home
  • Keep furry pets out of bedrooms
  • Limit furry pets to one area of home
  • Wash furry pets often
  • Vacuum home often

AEROSOL SPRAYS and strong scents (like perfume, hairspray, and cleaning products) can be an inhaled irritant and trigger asthma symptoms for some people with asthma. 

How to avoid - reduce this trigger ?

  • Avoid using aerosol sprays indoors
  • Avoid products with strong odors
  • Avoid use of products that are heavily scented
  • Air out the room when sprays are used
targets.Name: Perfume

targets.Name: HairSpray

Text:
DUST MITES are found in rugs. 

Dust mites can be an allergy trigger for some people with asthma.

Dust mites are so tiny they can’t be seen with the eye.

They live in items made of thick fibers, such as bedding, carpets, pillows, sofas, rugs and stuffed toys. 

Dust mites live and multiply in high humidity.

          How to avoid -reduce this trigger ?

 

- Wash small area rugs often with hot water      and dry on high heat
targets.Name: Rug

Text: This Plunger Isn't an Asthma Trigger that I know of

targets.Name: Plunger

Text:
Fumes from BLEACH and other common cleaning products and detergents can be an inhaled trigger for some people with asthma.

      

  • Use non-scented household cleaning products
  • Avoid cleaning with products that have strong odors
  • Clean when the person with asthma is not in the area
  • Open windows and doors or use a fan to move the air when cleaning
  • Do not use full strength when directions say to dilute product with water
  • Air out the room after cleaning
targets.Name: Clorox
targets.Title: Strong Odors

Text:
